entry.title: SUV CRASHES IN VEHICLE VERSUS DEER ACCIDENT
entry.summary: An SUV crashed in a vehicle versus deer accident on Tuesday. An Oregon State Police report said at about 6:50 a.m. the wreck happened on Interstate Five northbound, about two miles north of the Canyon Creek summit. The driver said he swerved to miss the animal and lost control of his vehicle. The SUV left...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE CITE MAN FOR UNAUTHORIZED USE OF A VEHICLE
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 10:50 a.m. Roseburg Police cited a man for unauthorized use of a vehicle on Saturday, following an alleged prior incident. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING REPORTED DISTURBANCE ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 10:40 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man following a reported disturbance on Saturday. An RPD report said shortly after 5:00 p.m. officers contacted the 47-year old at a business in the 1200 block of Northeast Stephens Street after receiving multiple calls that he was yelling and causing a disturbance. Dispatch had received...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WOMAN JAILED FOR ALLEGED CRIMINAL TRESPASS

entry.title: JUVENILE MALE DETAINED FOR REPORTED HARASSMENT
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 10:15 a.m. A juvenile male was detained by Roseburg Police for reported harassment, on Friday night. An RPD report said at 10:50 p.m. officers responded to the 400 block of Southeast Dillard Avenue regarding a disturbance. Officers learned that the suspect had allegedly punched and bit two victims because they would not...

entry.title: Garage fire lead to roof collapse
entry.summary: A garage fire led to a roof collapse on Tuesday morning, southeast of Winston.

entry.title: Winter Whale Watch Week: Gray whales travel along the Oregon Coast
entry.summary: Winter Whale Watch Week returns Wednesday.

entry.title: GARAGE FIRE LEADS TO ROOF COLLAPSE
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 4:00 a.m. A garage fire led to a roof collapse on Tuesday morning, southeast of Winston. Information from the Winston-Dillard Fire District said shortly after 6:00 a.m. crews were dispatched to the 12000 block of Old Highway 99 South, for a reported garage fire. First arriving crews noted heavy smoke and fire...

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7:00 P.M. WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:50 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect through 7:00 p.m. Wednesday for parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said southeast winds of 25 to 35 miles per hour with gusts up to 50 miles per hour are expected. The Advisory area includes the eastern Douglas County foothills...

entry.title: HIGH SURF WARNING UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:30 a.m. A High Surf Warning is in effect until 10:00 p.m. Thursday for the south-central Oregon coast and the Curry County coast. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said that large breaking waves of 20 to 25 feet are expected through Wednesday afternoon. Dangerous breaking waves of 25 to 35 feet...

entry.title: RPS CONTINUES MEAL DISTRIBUTION THROUGH FRIDAY
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:20 a.m. Roseburg Public Schools continues with free meal distribution to children and youth for the remainder of the winter break, via the LunchBox Express bus. An RPS release said the meals are available to all those age 18 and younger. They will be distributed daily through Friday. Times may vary due...

entry.title: VINTAGE SINGERS PERFORM TWELFTH NIGHT CONCERT
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:20 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Umpqua Community College Performing and Visual Arts present the Vintage Singers performing the annual Twelfth Night concert on Friday, January 5th at 7:00 p.m. and Sunday January 7th at 3:00 p.m. Both performances will be at First Presbyterian Church on Southeast Lane Avenue in downtown...

entry.title: VISITORS CAN BOOK SAME-DAY RESERVATIONS STATEWIDE STARTING SOON
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:10 a.m. Visitors hoping to camp last minute will soon have the chance to view and book same-day campsite openings statewide starting on January 1st. A release from the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department said previously, most sites required booking 24 hours or more in advance of arrival when reserving online. Same-day...

entry.title: SLEEP IN THE DEEP RETURNS TO OREGON COAST AQUARIUM
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 3:00 a.m. Oregon Coast Aquarium in Newport has announced the relaunching of its highly popular “Sleep in the Deep” program, once again giving guests the opportunity to “sleep with the fishes”. Communications and Marketing Specialist Courtney Klug said the sleepover program takes place in OCAq’s iconic Passages of the Deep exhibit. Klug...

entry.title: SENATORS ANNOUNCE $2.2 MILLION FOR RURAL HYBRID PROGRAM
entry.summary: December 27, 2023 2:50 a.m. Oregon Senators Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley have announced a $2.2 million federal grant from the U.S. Department of Education’s Rural Postsecondary and Economic Development Program for Chemeketa Community College. Wyden said, “Students of all backgrounds deserve a fair shot at a solid education”. Wyden said, “This funding is the...

entry.title: TRUE WEALTH 12.26.23
entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dickson have our weekly local financial program. Click here to download for later listening. Click here to download for later listening. TRUE WEALTH 12 26 2023

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.26.23
entry.summary: Roseburg VA Medical Center Director Patrick Hull provides an update on things happening and planned for the local campus, which he has been leading since April. Click here to download for later listening: IDC 12 26 2023

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 1 Tyee Ridge Fire
entry.summary: The Tyee Ridge Complex fire burned nearly 8,000 acres of land west of Roseburg after an August lightning storm struck the country side over 100 times, starting multiple fires.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 5 shooting hoax
entry.summary: Chaos erupted on the morning of Feb. 21, when active shooter calls rang out from schools across the county.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 6 Roseburg addresses homelessness
entry.summary: After more than a year in the works, the city of Roseburg opened the indoor section of the Gary Leif Navigation Center in September, providing an additional 30 beds for the homeless.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 7 school bonds fail
entry.summary: Roseburg and Oakland schools tried to get voter approval and tax dollars to make some much needed repairs to their aging school buildings.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 8 Deputy fired from DCSO
entry.summary: Mason Goodknight was discharged from his position as a Douglas County Sheriff’s Office corrections deputy on April 4 for refusing to follow the transgender policy at the jail.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: honorable mention: New medical leaders in Roseburg
entry.summary: Patrick Hull — Roseburg VA Director

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 3 Archie Creek settlements
entry.summary: Utility company PacifiCorp, parent company of Pacific Power, reached a $299 million settlement with 463 individual plaintiffs on Dec. 5, for lawsuits related to the Archie Creek Complex Fire. On Dec. 15, PacifiCorp settled at $250 million with 10 companies…

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 4 WinCo Foods opens in Roseburg
entry.summary: WinCo Foods opened its doors in Roseburg just ahead of schedule on Nov. 6 as a long line formed outside the company’s 140th location.

entry.title: NeighborWorks Umpqua receives grant to assist veterans
entry.summary: NeighborWorks Umpqua received a $44,160 Veteran Services Grant from the Oregon Department of Veterans’ Affairs for projects and services focusing on veterans.

entry.title: OSU Extension offers forestry program in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon State University Extension Office in Roseburg will offer a five-part series on small woodland management beginning on Jan. 24, 2024. The office is located at 1134 SE Douglas Ave. in Roseburg.

entry.title: Fish and Wildlife to host hunting class in Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife will host a hunting education field day Jan. 20 at the Roseburg Rod and Gun Club, 875 Old Del Rio Road, Roseburg. The class will run 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and…

entry.title: Everyone deserves a warm Christmas meal, woman hands out cookies and burritos
entry.summary: Dee Jay spent her weekend rolling bean, cheese and rice burritos, and baking sheets of sugar and oatmeal chocolate chip cookies for her holiday tradition: handing them out to the homeless community.
